pageContext.description: There is an inscription on the bevel: "Inventus Bruwell palustre. F.D. 1860. Dons dedit R. R. Fielder. Jes. Coll. Contab. Mus. Fitz. Gul." Midrib and bevels. 2 rivets. Slightly bent.
pageContext.patina: Dark brown and green patina and some metal showing through.
pageContext.surface: Rougher on one side than the other.
pageContext.other: Width: blade at section 28mm; hilt plate 60mm
pageContext.publications: Prehistoric Bronzes, 125, No catalogue.,Bronzes 100. The numbers can be found in a catalogue called "Museum of Archaeology.",B.A.V. Trump, P.P.S., 1962, No. 5, No. 36
pageContext.collection: Museum of Archaeology, Cambridge,Transferred from the Fitzwilliam Museum
